module.p: Verbs are words which describe ‘situations’ – states, events, actions, processes, activities.
Every verb describes a situation, but not every word describing a situation is a verb (cf. verbal nouns, adverbs).

section.p:
Verbs are divided into three groups, depending on how they are formed –
Derived verbs are formed out of adjectives or nouns, usually by addition of a suffix – gealaich whiten, cuimhnich remember, ...
Compound verbs are formed out of other verbs, usually by addition of a prefix – ath-sgrìobh rewrite, craobh-sgaoil broadcast, ...
Simple verbs are not formed out of other words – cuir put, fosgail open, ...
